meanings.definition: An instrument for detecting the presence and sign of electric charges.
meanings.sent1: The electroscope showed that the object had an electric charge.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use an electroscope to find out if something has electricity.
meanings.sent3: The electroscope was so excited to find the electric charge, it jumped up and down.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like an electroscope, always sensing the hidden charges in people's words.
meanings.sent5: The electroscope hummed with energy as it detected the electric charges in the air.

meanings.definition: To detect the presence and sign of electric charges using an electroscope.
meanings.sent1: I will electroscope the object to see if it has any electric charges.
meanings.sent2: She electroscopeed the wire to check for electricity.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to electroscope the static on its fur with hilarious results.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to electroscope the truth in her words, seeing through any deception.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mind worked like an electroscope, picking up on the subtlest clues.
